Dictionary.Name: The Collaborative International Dictionary of English v.0.44

Definition.WordDefinition:
hangover \hangover\ n. 1. An unpleasant feeling, such as a headache, occurring as an aftereffect from the use of drugs (especially alcohol). [WordNet 1.5 +PJC]
2. an official who remains in office after his term.
Syn: holdover. [WordNet 1.5]

hangover n 1: disagreeable aftereffects from the use of drugs (especially alcohol) [syn: {katzenjammer}] 2: an official who remains in office after his term [syn: {holdover}] 3: something that has survived from the past; "a holdover from the sixties"; "hangovers from the 19th century" [syn: {holdover}]
